intro: Uraspermum divaricatum, commonly known as the variable uraspermum, is a flowering plant species native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. Its flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, with five petals and stamens that are often longer than the petals. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
